channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: Egypt is inaugurating the Grand Egyptian Museum, the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization and an effort aimed at boosting the country's tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: By Samy Magdy, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Tanzania President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: DODOMA, Tanzania (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday, in a rare landslide victory in the region.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Red Cross confirms remains of three hostages return to Israel ‘for the first time’ as families await answers
item.description: The International Red Cross oversaw a body transfer under humanitarian law as parties work to return the deceased to families during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump won't send 'high level' representatives to COP30 climate summit
item.description: The U.S. won’t be sending any “high level” representatives to this year’s United Nations climate summit, a White House official told The Hill on Friday. The summit, known as COP30, will be held in Brazil next month.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Trump designates Nigeria as 'country of particular concern' over widespread Christian persecution, killings
item.description: Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Americans more likely to oppose boat strikes, military invasion of Venezuela: Survey
item.description: A YouGov survey has found that Americans are more likely to oppose U.S. strikes against boats near Venezuela than support them after a month of attacks on vessels suspected of transporting drugs off the country’s coast. Americans also strongly opposed the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: U.S. national intelligence director Tulsi Gabbard says America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” has ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: The World Health Organization reports that gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan's Darfur region returned three times to the facility during their assault.
item.dc:creator: Jamey Keaten And Sarah El Deeb, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Russia deploys 170,000 troops for push in Ukraine's Donetsk region, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia has deployed around 170,000 troops in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region where they are trying to capture the stronghold of Pokrovsk in a major push for a battlefield victory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: LONDON (AP) — King Charles III on Thursday stripped his disgraced brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicted him from his royal residence after weeks of pressure to act over his relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Buckingham Palace said.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY and JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Outrage as Swedish court refuses to deport convicted rapist, PM promises crackdown
item.description: Swedish court sparks outrage by refusing to deport convicted rapist, citing crime wasn't 'exceptionally grave.' PM promises toughest Nordic deportation laws.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on as death toll from Gaza strikes reaches 104
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israel’s military said Wednesday that the ceasefire was back on in Gaza after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight across the Palestinian territory that killed 104 people, including 66 women and children, according to local health officials.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Antisemitic attacker faced 30-year sentence, gets less than 1½ years in plea deal
item.description: Tarek Bazrouk, a 20-year-old Palestinian American, was sentenced to 17 months in prison for federal hate crimes after attacking Jewish protesters in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Frontlines with Robert Sherman: All eyes on China, US relationship
item.description: The two heads of state representing the two most powerful economies in the world are set to meet face-to-face within the next few hours.
item.dc:creator: Robert Sherman, NewsNation

item.title: Corpses line Rio street, pushing death toll from police raids to 132
item.description: The police operation came days before Rio hosts global events related to the United Nations climate summit known as COP30
item.dc:creator: Janaina Quinet and Rodrigo Viga Gaier / Reuters, NewsNation

item.title: Prince Andrew hosted Epstein, Maxwell at Royal Lodge: Reports
item.description: Prince Andrew recently gave up his royal title amid ongoing scrutiny over his association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Putin hails successful test of nuclear-powered underwater torpedo
item.description: Putin announced successful Poseidon nuclear drone testing as President Donald Trump urged Russia to end the Ukraine war instead of testing missiles on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: New Jersey man's Titanic belongings recovered expected to auction for more than $100K
item.description: Frederick Sutton's Titanic personal effects, including gold watch and first-class passenger list, remain in family hands for over a century before auction.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump arrives in South Korea for key talks ahead of APEC summit, Xi meeting
item.description: Donald Trump visits Seoul for talks with President Lee Jae Myung focused on trade, investment, and maintaining stability amid growing tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Amnesty says deadly US strike on Yemen prison may be a war crime
item.description: An American airstrike in April on a prison run by Yemen's Houthi rebels killed more than 60 detained African migrants.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Man accused of stabbing teens with fork on international flight
item.description: Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, 28, was charged with assault with a dangerous weapon with intent to cause bodily harm on an aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from Paris' Louvre museum
item.description: PARIS (AP) — Two suspects were arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, justice and police officials said Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world and sparked a massive manhunt.
item.dc:creator: SAMUEL PETREQUIN and NICOLAS GARRIGA, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC
